result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Burdine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  PSI reviewed, Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
As to Count 1 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/Counts.
As to Count 2 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/Counts.


Court STAYED the sentence in counts 1 and 2 and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 4 Months condition time with Huber for work for both jobs.  Court stayed commencement until February 4, 2016 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form
PSI Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   At the hour of 12:05pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY as to Counts 1 (Possession With Intent-THC (>200-1000g) Party to a Crime) & 2 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place Party to a Crime) which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  

Court GRANTS state motion for PSI without recommendation.

Court DENIED state motion for remand, bail to remain as set.

State withdrew all exhibits.

Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert Lee Burdine
Current: 5421 North 39th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 11-18-2015)
Prior: 1514 W Clarke St, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 9:09am jury back in box.
Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 10:05am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Woida and Camuy who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury out of box.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
At the hour of 1:48pm jury back in box.

Testimony from previously sworn witness Milwaukee Police Officer Eric Rom continued.

Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Mitchell Ward. 

Exhibit  39 received.  

Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  State rests subject to rebuttal. Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  Jury in the box.  In the presence of the jury, the state rests subject to rebuttal.

Sworn for defense: Robert Burdine.  

At the hour of 4:12pm jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:55am on 11/18/2015.  Jury trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court grants the state's motion to orally amend the address on the criminal complaint from 1514 to 1512.  At the hour of 9:07am jury back in box.

Testimony from previously sworn witness Milwaukee Police Officer Christine Rutherford continued.

Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Joel Susler, Milwaukee Police Forensic Investigators Lee Vedbraaten and Andrew Smith, WI State Crime Lab Analyst Laura Hedden and Milwaukee Police Officer Eric Rom.

Exhibits 2 and 32-38 received.  

Exhibit 33 published to the jury.

At the hour of 11:53am jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:25pm.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidebars placed on the record.  At the hour of 1:56pm jury panel back in court.  Voir dire continued.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  

Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officers Michael Shwandt and Adam Isleb. 
Exhibits 1 and 5 received and published to the jury.

Jury out of box.  Sidebars placed on the record.  Jury back in box.

Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Christine Rutherford.
Exhibits 3, 4 and 7-31 received.  
Exhibits 1, 3-5, 12-23, 30 and 31 published to the jury.

At the hour of 4:42pm jury dismissed for the day, but ordered to return at 8:55am on 11/17/2015.  Sidebars places on the record.  Exhibit list received and filed.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.   Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 10:46am.  Court partially instructed jury.  At the hour of 12:01pm jury dismissed for lunch, but ordered to return at 1:25pm.

Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 11/16/2015 at 9:00am.  State rescinded their offer.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to add Count 2- Keeping A Drug House, Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.42(1), 939.50(3)(i) and 939.05, a Class I Felony.

Jury trial scheduled for 9/28/2015 at 09:00 am. has been vacated.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 7/14/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defense requests an adjourned Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense received discovery on todays date. Case calendared for STATUS on 6/3/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing 05/01/2015 received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Mr. John Forrestal, Forestal Law, LLC, 828 North Broadway #800, Milwaukee, WI 53202.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Eric Rom-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Nicholas Cerwin for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State is requesting an adjournment, officer is not present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Court informs the State that they are expected to be ready to proceed with the Preliminary Hearing on the next scheduled court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the signature bond that was previously signed in the county jail to continue. Signature bond is not in the file at this time.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Lee Burdine in court with attorney John J. Forrestal.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
